â— Step 12: UX Consistency Patterns                                                                                                                                      
  Here are the consistency patterns for VLPRS, prioritised by the patterns most critical to adoption and non-punitive design compliance.                                
  ---                                                                                                                                                                   Button Hierarchy                                                                                                                                                    

  Primary Action (Oyo Crimson #9C1E23):
  - When to use: The single most important action on a screen. One per visible context.
  - Visual: Crimson fill, white text, 6px radius, 40px height (48px mobile)
  - Examples: "Submit Monthly Data," "Share as PDF," "Login," "Accept as Declared"
  - Hover: #7A181D (Crimson Dark). Focus: 2px teal ring.

  Secondary Action (Teal Outline #0D7377):
  - When to use: Supporting actions alongside a primary. Multiple allowed per screen.
  - Visual: Teal border, teal text, transparent fill, 6px radius
  - Examples: "Download Template," "View Detail," "Add Note," "Filter"
  - Hover: Teal 50 #E0F5F5 fill. Focus: 2px teal ring.

  Tertiary Action (Ghost):
  - When to use: Low-priority actions, navigation links, inline actions within content.
  - Visual: No border, no fill, teal text, underline on hover
  - Examples: "How was this calculated?," "View all," "Clear filters," "Cancel"
  - Hover: Underline. Focus: 2px teal ring.

  Destructive Action (Danger #DC2626):
  - When to use: ONLY for irreversible actions requiring confirmation. Never for data variances.
  - Visual: Red outline (default), red fill (confirmation dialog only)
  - Examples: "Delete Record," "Revoke Access" â€” always behind AlertDialog confirmation
  - Rule: Destructive actions always require a two-step confirmation (Dialog with explicit text).

  Button Rules:
  - One primary button per visible context â€” never two crimson buttons competing
  - Icon + text for action buttons (icon-only prohibited except in compact table rows)
  - Minimum touch target: 44x44px on all devices
  - Disabled state: 40% opacity, cursor-not-allowed, no tooltip (explain why disabled in adjacent text)

  ---
  Feedback Patterns

  Success (Green #16A34A):
  - When to use: Completed actions, aligned records, loan completion, successful upload
  - Visual: Green left border or green checkmark icon + "Complete"/"Aligned"/"Upload Complete" text
  - Component: Toast notification (bottom-right, auto-dismiss 5s) for actions. Inline success panel for submissions.
  - Example: "Upload Complete â€” Reference: BIR-2026-02-0001" with green checkmark

  Attention (Gold #D4A017):
  - When to use: Items needing review, pending actions, approaching deadlines
  - Visual: Gold badge with text label, gold left border on cards, gold dot indicator
  - Component: AttentionItemCard with gold "Review" badge
  - Example: "3 MDAs pending submission â€” Review" with gold badge
  - Rule: Attention is warm and informational â€” never urgent or alarming

  Information / Variance (Teal #0D7377 icon, Grey #6B7280 background):
  - When to use: Comparisons, variances, educational detail, expandable information
  - Visual: Teal info circle (â„¹) icon + grey-tinted background panel + neutral text
  - Component: NonPunitiveVarianceDisplay
  - Example: "â„¹ Variance: â‚¦4,166.25 â€” Expand for details" on neutral grey background
  - Rule: NEVER use warning triangle (âš ), error cross (âœ—), or red colour for variances

  Needs Attention (Amber #D4A017 border):
  - When to use: Upload validation failures, form errors, items requiring user action
  - Visual: Amber left border, "needs attention" header, specific actionable instructions
  - Example: "Upload needs attention â€” Row 12: Staff ID 3301 appears twice"
  - Rule: Header NEVER says "Error" or "Failed." Always "needs attention" or "requires review."

  Neutral / Pending (Teal #0D7377):
  - When to use: Awaiting action, not yet submitted, in progress
  - Visual: Teal "Pending" badge, teal clock icon, muted text
  - Example: "Pending â€” Awaiting March 2026 submission"

  Non-Punitive Feedback Rules:
  1. Every feedback indicator uses colour + icon + text â€” never colour alone
  2. Red (#DC2626) appears ONLY for destructive action buttons â€” never in data feedback
  3. Variance/comparison feedback uses grey background + teal icon â€” never amber or red
  4. "Error" word is banned from data-facing feedback â€” use "needs attention," "variance," "comparison"
  5. Toast notifications auto-dismiss at 5s for success, persist until dismissed for attention items

  ---
  Form Patterns

  Input Fields:
  - Label always visible above input (never placeholder-only)
  - 16px minimum font size (prevents iOS zoom)
  - Border: #E2E8F0 default, #0D7377 teal focus ring (2px), #D4A017 amber for validation issues
  - Helper text below input in #64748B secondary text colour
  - Required fields: asterisk (*) after label, never rely on colour alone

  Validation:
  - Validate on blur (not on keystroke â€” avoids premature error display)
  - Inline validation message appears below the field in amber text
  - Language: "Staff ID should be a 4-digit number" â€” not "Invalid Staff ID"
  - Form submission blocked only when critical fields are empty/malformed
  - CSV upload: atomic validation â€” all-or-nothing, never partial processing

  Form Layout:
  - Single column on mobile, two columns on desktop for related field pairs
  - Primary submit button full-width on mobile, right-aligned on desktop
  - Cancel/back action as ghost button, never equally weighted with submit
  - Pre-fill where possible: MDA code from profile, period from current month

  File Upload:
  - FileUploadZone component with drag-drop and click-to-browse
  - Accepted types clearly stated: "CSV files (.csv) only"
  - Template download link always visible near upload zone
  - Progress bar during upload with percentage
  - Success: green checkmark + filename + "Upload Complete"
  - Rejection: amber border + specific row-level issues + re-upload zone on same screen

  ---
  Navigation Patterns

  Sidebar (Desktop):
  - Fixed 256px width, Oyo Crimson #9C1E23 background, white text/icons
  - Navigation items: icon + label, 48px row height, hover #7A181D background
  - Active item: white left border accent + #7A181D background
  - Collapsible sections for grouped items (Dashboard, Loans, Reports, Administration)
  - User avatar + role badge at bottom

  Mobile Header + Sheet:
  - Crimson header bar with hamburger menu, app title, search icon
  - Sheet overlay (from left) for full navigation menu on tap
  - Same navigation structure as desktop sidebar, optimised for touch (56px row height)

  Breadcrumb Drill-Down:
  - Appears below header on drill-down pages: Dashboard > Ministry of Health > Staff 7823
  - Each level is a teal link (clickable to navigate up)
  - Current level is plain text (not clickable)
  - Maximum 3 levels deep (matches progressive disclosure architecture)

  Tabs:
  - Used for switching between related views within a page (e.g., report types, dashboard sections)
  - Active tab: crimson underline + bold text
  - Inactive tab: grey text, no underline
  - Mobile: horizontal scroll if tabs exceed screen width (no wrapping)

  Back Navigation:
  - Browser back button always works (SPA history management)
  - Explicit "Back" ghost button on detail pages for discoverability
  - Breadcrumb provides upward navigation at any depth

  ---
  Data Display Patterns

  Tables:
  - Default: comfortable row height (48px), #F8FAFC alternating row background
  - Dense mode (toggle): 36px row height for power users (Dept Admin)
  - Sortable columns: click header to sort, teal arrow indicator for sort direction
  - Sticky header on scroll
  - Mobile: horizontal scroll with first column (identifier) sticky
  - Empty table: "No records found" with contextual suggestion (e.g., "No loans matching your search. Try a different Staff ID.")

  Status Indicators:
  - Always colour + icon + text label (never colour alone)
  - Consistent vocabulary across all contexts:

  â”‚ Needs Review     â”‚ Gold #D4A017                â”‚ Flag      â”‚ "Review"               â”‚
  â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤

  â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤

  Currency Display:
  - Always use NairaDisplay component for consistency
  - Format: â‚¦1,840,000.00 (symbol + thousands separator + 2 decimals)
  - Tabular nums (font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums) for column alignment
  - JetBrains Mono in table cells, Inter elsewhere
  - No negative numbers displayed in red â€” use minus sign and neutral colour

  Numbers and Counts:
  - Large counts (dashboard): Hero treatment with count-up animation (200ms)
  - Table counts: Right-aligned, tabular nums
  - Percentages: One decimal place (94.2%), no decimal for 100% or 0%

  ---
  Empty States & Loading

  Skeleton Loaders (AG Dashboard):
  - Render layout skeleton within 1 second of navigation
  - Pulse animation on skeleton blocks (grey #E2E8F0)
  - Replace skeleton with real data as each API response arrives (progressive hydration)
  - Never show a blank white screen or full-page spinner

  Empty Dashboard (First Use):
  - "Welcome to VLPRS" header with brief orientation
  - Clear first-action CTA: "Start by importing your first MDA" or "Submit your first monthly data"
  - No empty cards with "No data" â€” show the onboarding action instead

  No Search Results:
  - "No records found for [search term]" with suggestions
  - "Try searching by Staff ID, name, or MDA code"
  - Search field retains the query (no clearing on empty result)

  Loading States:
  - API calls: Skeleton loader (dashboard), inline spinner (form submission), progress bar (file upload)
  - Never block the full page â€” loading is always localised to the affected component
  - Timeout: If API takes >10 seconds, show "This is taking longer than expected" with option to retry

  ---
  Search & Filtering

  Global Search (Command Palette):
  - Always visible in header bar (desktop: full search input, mobile: search icon â†’ expanding input)
  - Searches: Staff ID, staff name, MDA name, loan reference number
  - Instant results as-you-type (debounced 300ms)
  - Results grouped by type: Staff, MDAs, Loans
  - Keyboard shortcut: Ctrl+K / Cmd+K to focus search (power user pattern from Linear)

  Table Filtering:
  - Filter controls above table, collapsible on mobile
  - Filter by: MDA (dropdown), status (multi-select badges), date range (date picker)
  - Active filters shown as dismissible chips below filter bar
  - "Clear all filters" link when any filter is active
  - Filter state preserved in URL query parameters (shareable filtered views)

  Sort:
  - Click column header to toggle sort (ascending â†’ descending â†’ none)
  - Active sort indicated by teal arrow in column header
  - Default sort: most recent first (date), highest priority first (exceptions)

  ---
  Modal & Overlay Patterns

  Dialog (Confirmation):
  - Used for: destructive action confirmation, important decisions
  - Centred overlay with backdrop blur
  - Clear title, concise description, two buttons (cancel ghost + action primary/destructive)
  - Escape key and backdrop click dismiss (except destructive confirmation)

  Sheet (Mobile Sidebar & Detail Panels):
  - Used for: mobile navigation, quick detail views on mobile
  - Slides from left (navigation) or right (detail)
  - Full viewport height, 85% width max
  - Swipe to dismiss supported

  Tooltip:
  - Used for: icon-only buttons (rare), abbreviated text, supplementary information
  - Appears on hover (desktop) / long-press (mobile)
  - Max width 250px, plain text only
  - Never used for essential information â€” tooltips are supplementary

  Popover:
  - Used for: filter dropdowns, date pickers, contextual actions
  - Positioned below trigger element, responsive repositioning on viewport edge
  - Click outside or Escape to dismiss

  ---
  Non-Punitive Language Patterns (VLPRS-Specific)

  The most critical consistency pattern in the entire system. These rules have absolute authority over all other UX patterns:

  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

  The MDA Officer Test: Before shipping any screen, ask: "Would an MDA officer feel defensive looking at this?" If yes, redesign the language, iconography, or colour 
  until the answer is no.

  ---
  Design System Integration Notes

  shadcn/ui Customisation:
  - Badge variants extended: review (gold), info (teal), complete (green), pending (grey), variance (grey bg + teal icon)
  - Toast (Sonner) themed: success (green left border), attention (gold left border), info (teal left border)
  - Table extended with dense mode toggle and sticky header
  - Command palette (search) themed with crimson accent on selected item
  - Sidebar component uses crimson background with white text override

  CSS Custom Properties (Pattern Tokens):
  --button-primary: #9C1E23
  --button-primary-hover: #7A181D
  --button-secondary: #0D7377
  --button-destructive: #DC2626
  --feedback-success: #16A34A
  --feedback-attention: #D4A017
  --feedback-variance-bg: #6B7280
  --feedback-variance-icon: #0D7377
  --feedback-pending: #6B7280
  --focus-ring: #0D7377

  Pattern Enforcement Strategy:
  - Non-punitive language patterns documented as linting rules in code review checklist
  - Colour usage restricted through Tailwind config â€” danger colours only available via destructive variant
  - Badge component enforces colour + text pairing â€” no text-less badges in the component API

  [P] Party Mode â€” bring multiple perspectives on UX consistency

      844 +### Custom Components                                                                                                                                      
      845 +                                                                                                                                                           
      846 +#### 1. HeroMetricCard                                                                                                                                     
      847 +                                                                                                                                                           
      848 +**Purpose:** Display a single KPI as a large, instantly readable number on the AG dashboard. The system's most important visual element.                   
      849 +**Content:** Metric label, primary value (â‚¦ or count), period indicator, trend arrow (optional)                                                            
      850 +**Actions:** Click â†’ drill-down to MDA-level breakdown                                                                                                     
      851 +**States:** Loading (skeleton pulse), Populated (count-up animation), Hover (subtle lift shadow)                                                           
      852 +**Variants:** Currency (â‚¦1,840,000,000), Count (3,147), Percentage (94.2%)                                                                                 
      853 +**Accessibility:** `role="link"` with `aria-label="Active Loans: 3,147. Click to view breakdown"`. Tabular nums for screen reader number parsing.          
      854 +                                                                                                                                                           
      855 +#### 2. AttentionItemCard                                                                                                                                  
      856 +                                                                                                                                                           
      857 +**Purpose:** Display a single attention-worthy item in the AG's priority feed. Must feel informational, not alarming.                                      
      858 +**Content:** Item description, MDA name, category badge (gold "Review" / teal "Info" / green "Complete"), timestamp                                        
      859 +**Actions:** Click â†’ navigate to detail view                                                                                                               
      860 +**States:** Default, Hover (background tint), New (subtle left-border accent)                                                                              
      861 +**Variants:** Review (gold badge), Info (teal badge), Complete (green badge)                                                                               
      862 +**Accessibility:** `role="listitem"` within attention list. Badge uses colour + text (never colour alone). `aria-label` includes full context.             
      863 +                                                                                                                                                           
      864 +#### 3. NonPunitiveVarianceDisplay                                                                                                                         
      865 +                                                                                                                                                           
      866 +**Purpose:** The system's most critical custom component. Shows discrepancies as neutral comparisons â€” the UX that determines whether MDAs adopt or        
          +resist.                                                                                                                                                    
      867 +**Content:** Record identifier, declared value, computed value, difference amount, mathematical explanation                                                
      868 +**Actions:** Expand for full computation detail, collapse to summary                                                                                       
      869 +**States:** Collapsed (summary line with info icon), Expanded (full comparison with math), Neutral (no hover colour change that implies urgency)           
      870 +**Variants:** Minor variance (<â‚¦500, compact), Standard variance (full detail), Summary mode (count only: "3 variances â„¹")                                 
      871 +**Accessibility:** Info icon uses `aria-label="Information: variance of â‚¦4,166.25"`. Never uses `role="alert"` â€” this is information, not an error.        
          +Expandable region uses `aria-expanded`.                                                                                                                    
      872 +**Content Guidelines:** Header always says "Comparison" or "Variance" â€” never "Error," "Discrepancy," or "Mismatch." Icon is always info circle (â„¹)        
          +in teal â€” never warning triangle.                                                                                                                          
      873 +

      876 +**Purpose:** Side-by-side view of MDA-declared values vs system-computed values. The trust-building centrepiece.                                           
      877 +**Content:** Left panel (Declared â€” white), Right panel (Computed â€” teal-tinted), Bottom bar (Difference + explanation)                                    
      878 +**Actions:** Expand "How was this calculated?" accordion per row                                                                                           
      879 +**States:** Default (split view), Mobile (stacked â€” declared above, computed below), Loading (skeleton)

      881 +**Accessibility:** Panels labelled with `aria-label="MDA Declared Values"` and `aria-label="System Computed Values"`. Difference row announces both        
          +values and delta.

      887 +**Actions:** Expand/collapse, copy computation reference

      889 +**Variants:** Balance computation (ledger â†’ sum), Interest computation (principal Ã— rate Ã— time), Variance explanation (declared - computed = differ       
          +ence, because...)                                                                                                                                          
      890 +**Accessibility:** Uses shadcn Accordion with `aria-label="View calculation details"`. Monospace font (JetBrains Mono) for numbers in derivation cha

      897 +**States:** Default (dashed border, teal icon), Dragover (teal background tint, border solid), Uploading (progress bar), Success (green checkmark, f

      898 +**Variants:** CSV upload (MDA submission), Excel upload (migration import)                                                                                 
      899 +**Accessibility:** `role="button"` on click zone. `aria-label="Upload CSV file. Drag and drop or click to browse."` Progress bar with `aria-valuenow       
          +`.                                                                                                                                                         
      900 +**Content Guidelines:** Error state header says "Upload needs attention" â€” never "Upload failed" or "Error."                                               
      901 +                                                                                                                                                           
      902 +#### 7. SubmissionConfirmation                                                                                                                             
      903 +                                                                                                                                                           
      904 +**Purpose:** Immediate positive acknowledgment after successful data submission. Appears BEFORE any comparison data (Confirm, Then Compare principle       
          +).

      906 +**Actions:** Copy reference number, proceed to comparison view                                                                                             
      907 +**States:** Single state (success) â€” this component only renders on success                                                                                
      908 +**Variants:** Standard submission (monthly), Migration import (baseline acknowledgment)

      910 +

      947 +### Component Implementation Strategy                                                                                                                      
      948 +                                                                                                                                                           
      949 +**Foundation Components (from shadcn/ui â€” use as-is or with minor theme customization):**                                                                  
      950 +- Card, Button, Input, Select, Label, Form â€” standard form and layout building blocks                                                                      
      951 +- Table â€” backbone for loan records, exception queues, migration lists                                                                                     
      952 +- Badge â€” status indicators (themed to non-punitive colour tokens)                                                                                         
      953 +- Accordion â€” base for computation transparency                                                                                                            
      954 +- Skeleton â€” loading states for AG dashboard                                                                                                               
      955 +- Breadcrumb â€” drill-down navigation                                                                                                                       
      956 +- Command â€” global search (staff ID lookup)                                                                                                                
      957 +- Toast (Sonner) â€” action confirmations                                                                                                                    
      958 +- Dialog/AlertDialog â€” destructive action confirmation                                                                                                     
      959 +- Sheet â€” mobile sidebar overlay                                                                                                                           
      960 +- Tabs â€” report type selection, dashboard sections                                                                                                         
      961 +- Progress â€” upload and migration progress bars                                                                                                            
      962 +- Sidebar â€” crimson sidebar navigation                                                                                                                     
      963 +                                                                                                                                                           
      964 +**Custom Components (built using shadcn primitives + Tailwind):**                                                                                          
      965 +- All 11 custom components use shadcn Card, Badge, Accordion as base where applicable                                                                      
      966 +- Styled exclusively through Tailwind utilities and CSS custom properties                                                                                  
      967 +- Non-punitive design tokens (`--variance-bg`, `--attention-bg`, etc.) applied consistently                                                                
      968 +- Responsive behaviour defined per-component matching breakpoint strategy                                                                                  
      969 +                                                                                                                                                           
      970 +**Component Architecture Principles:**                                                                                                                     
      971 +1. **Composition over inheritance** â€” custom components compose shadcn primitives rather than forking them                                                 
      972 +2. **Token-driven styling** â€” all colours reference CSS custom properties, enabling future theme changes without component edits                           
      973 +3. **Accessibility inherited** â€” Radix UI foundations provide keyboard navigation, focus management, and ARIA attributes at the primitive level            
      974 +4. **Mobile-first responsive** â€” components designed phone-first, enhanced for desktop                                                                     
      975 +

â— Step 12: UX Consistency Patterns                                                                                                                                      
  Here are the consistency patterns for VLPRS, prioritised by the patterns most critical to adoption and non-punitive design compliance.                                
  ---                                                                                                                                                                   Button Hierarchy                                                                                                                                                    

  Primary Action (Oyo Crimson #9C1E23):
  - When to use: The single most important action on a screen. One per visible context.
  - Visual: Crimson fill, white text, 6px radius, 40px height (48px mobile)
  - Examples: "Submit Monthly Data," "Share as PDF," "Login," "Accept as Declared"
  - Hover: #7A181D (Crimson Dark). Focus: 2px teal ring.

  Secondary Action (Teal Outline #0D7377):
  - When to use: Supporting actions alongside a primary. Multiple allowed per screen.
  - Visual: Teal border, teal text, transparent fill, 6px radius
  - Examples: "Download Template," "View Detail," "Add Note," "Filter"
  - Hover: Teal 50 #E0F5F5 fill. Focus: 2px teal ring.

  Tertiary Action (Ghost):
  - When to use: Low-priority actions, navigation links, inline actions within content.
  - Visual: No border, no fill, teal text, underline on hover
  - Examples: "How was this calculated?," "View all," "Clear filters," "Cancel"
  - Hover: Underline. Focus: 2px teal ring.

  Destructive Action (Danger #DC2626):
  - When to use: ONLY for irreversible actions requiring confirmation. Never for data variances.
  - Visual: Red outline (default), red fill (confirmation dialog only)
  - Examples: "Delete Record," "Revoke Access" â€” always behind AlertDialog confirmation
  - Rule: Destructive actions always require a two-step confirmation (Dialog with explicit text).

  Button Rules:
  - One primary button per visible context â€” never two crimson buttons competing
  - Icon + text for action buttons (icon-only prohibited except in compact table rows)
  - Minimum touch target: 44x44px on all devices
  - Disabled state: 40% opacity, cursor-not-allowed, no tooltip (explain why disabled in adjacent text)

  ---
  Feedback Patterns

  Success (Green #16A34A):
  - When to use: Completed actions, aligned records, loan completion, successful upload
  - Visual: Green left border or green checkmark icon + "Complete"/"Aligned"/"Upload Complete" text
  - Component: Toast notification (bottom-right, auto-dismiss 5s) for actions. Inline success panel for submissions.
  - Example: "Upload Complete â€” Reference: BIR-2026-02-0001" with green checkmark

  Attention (Gold #D4A017):
  - When to use: Items needing review, pending actions, approaching deadlines
  - Visual: Gold badge with text label, gold left border on cards, gold dot indicator
  - Component: AttentionItemCard with gold "Review" badge
  - Example: "3 MDAs pending submission â€” Review" with gold badge
  - Rule: Attention is warm and informational â€” never urgent or alarming

  Information / Variance (Teal #0D7377 icon, Grey #6B7280 background):
  - When to use: Comparisons, variances, educational detail, expandable information
  - Visual: Teal info circle (â„¹) icon + grey-tinted background panel + neutral text
  - Component: NonPunitiveVarianceDisplay
  - Example: "â„¹ Variance: â‚¦4,166.25 â€” Expand for details" on neutral grey background
  - Rule: NEVER use warning triangle (âš ), error cross (âœ—), or red colour for variances

  Needs Attention (Amber #D4A017 border):
  - When to use: Upload validation failures, form errors, items requiring user action
  - Visual: Amber left border, "needs attention" header, specific actionable instructions
  - Example: "Upload needs attention â€” Row 12: Staff ID 3301 appears twice"
  - Rule: Header NEVER says "Error" or "Failed." Always "needs attention" or "requires review."

  Neutral / Pending (Teal #0D7377):
  - When to use: Awaiting action, not yet submitted, in progress
  - Visual: Teal "Pending" badge, teal clock icon, muted text
  - Example: "Pending â€” Awaiting March 2026 submission"

  Non-Punitive Feedback Rules:
  1. Every feedback indicator uses colour + icon + text â€” never colour alone
  2. Red (#DC2626) appears ONLY for destructive action buttons â€” never in data feedback
  3. Variance/comparison feedback uses grey background + teal icon â€” never amber or red
  4. "Error" word is banned from data-facing feedback â€” use "needs attention," "variance," "comparison"
  5. Toast notifications auto-dismiss at 5s for success, persist until dismissed for attention items

  ---
  Form Patterns

  Input Fields:
  - Label always visible above input (never placeholder-only)
  - 16px minimum font size (prevents iOS zoom)
  - Border: #E2E8F0 default, #0D7377 teal focus ring (2px), #D4A017 amber for validation issues
  - Helper text below input in #64748B secondary text colour
  - Required fields: asterisk (*) after label, never rely on colour alone

  Validation:
  - Validate on blur (not on keystroke â€” avoids premature error display)
  - Inline validation message appears below the field in amber text
  - Language: "Staff ID should be a 4-digit number" â€” not "Invalid Staff ID"
  - Form submission blocked only when critical fields are empty/malformed
  - CSV upload: atomic validation â€” all-or-nothing, never partial processing

  Form Layout:
  - Single column on mobile, two columns on desktop for related field pairs
  - Primary submit button full-width on mobile, right-aligned on desktop
  - Cancel/back action as ghost button, never equally weighted with submit
  - Pre-fill where possible: MDA code from profile, period from current month

  File Upload:
  - FileUploadZone component with drag-drop and click-to-browse
  - Accepted types clearly stated: "CSV files (.csv) only"
  - Template download link always visible near upload zone
  - Progress bar during upload with percentage
  - Success: green checkmark + filename + "Upload Complete"
  - Rejection: amber border + specific row-level issues + re-upload zone on same screen

  ---
  Navigation Patterns

  Sidebar (Desktop):
  - Fixed 256px width, Oyo Crimson #9C1E23 background, white text/icons
  - Navigation items: icon + label, 48px row height, hover #7A181D background
  - Active item: white left border accent + #7A181D background
  - Collapsible sections for grouped items (Dashboard, Loans, Reports, Administration)
  - User avatar + role badge at bottom

  Mobile Header + Sheet:
  - Crimson header bar with hamburger menu, app title, search icon
  - Sheet overlay (from left) for full navigation menu on tap
  - Same navigation structure as desktop sidebar, optimised for touch (56px row height)

  Breadcrumb Drill-Down:
  - Appears below header on drill-down pages: Dashboard > Ministry of Health > Staff 7823
  - Each level is a teal link (clickable to navigate up)
  - Current level is plain text (not clickable)
  - Maximum 3 levels deep (matches progressive disclosure architecture)

  Tabs:
  - Used for switching between related views within a page (e.g., report types, dashboard sections)
  - Active tab: crimson underline + bold text
  - Inactive tab: grey text, no underline
  - Mobile: horizontal scroll if tabs exceed screen width (no wrapping)

  Back Navigation:
  - Browser back button always works (SPA history management)
  - Explicit "Back" ghost button on detail pages for discoverability
  - Breadcrumb provides upward navigation at any depth

  ---
  Data Display Patterns

  Tables:
  - Default: comfortable row height (48px), #F8FAFC alternating row background
  - Dense mode (toggle): 36px row height for power users (Dept Admin)
  - Sortable columns: click header to sort, teal arrow indicator for sort direction
  - Sticky header on scroll
  - Mobile: horizontal scroll with first column (identifier) sticky
  - Empty table: "No records found" with contextual suggestion (e.g., "No loans matching your search. Try a different Staff ID.")

  Status Indicators:
  - Always colour + icon + text label (never colour alone)
  - Consistent vocabulary across all contexts:

  Currency Display:
  - Always use NairaDisplay component for consistency
  - Format: â‚¦1,840,000.00 (symbol + thousands separator + 2 decimals)
  - Tabular nums (font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums) for column alignment
  - JetBrains Mono in table cells, Inter elsewhere
  - No negative numbers displayed in red â€” use minus sign and neutral colour

  Numbers and Counts:
  - Large counts (dashboard): Hero treatment with count-up animation (200ms)
  - Table counts: Right-aligned, tabular nums
  - Percentages: One decimal place (94.2%), no decimal for 100% or 0%

  ---
  Empty States & Loading

  Skeleton Loaders (AG Dashboard):
  - Render layout skeleton within 1 second of navigation
  - Pulse animation on skeleton blocks (grey #E2E8F0)
  - Replace skeleton with real data as each API response arrives (progressive hydration)
  - Never show a blank white screen or full-page spinner

  Empty Dashboard (First Use):
  - "Welcome to VLPRS" header with brief orientation
  - Clear first-action CTA: "Start by importing your first MDA" or "Submit your first monthly data"
  - No empty cards with "No data" â€” show the onboarding action instead

  No Search Results:
  - "No records found for [search term]" with suggestions
  - "Try searching by Staff ID, name, or MDA code"
  - Search field retains the query (no clearing on empty result)

  Loading States:
  - API calls: Skeleton loader (dashboard), inline spinner (form submission), progress bar (file upload)
  - Never block the full page â€” loading is always localised to the affected component
  - Timeout: If API takes >10 seconds, show "This is taking longer than expected" with option to retry

  ---
  Search & Filtering

  Global Search (Command Palette):
  - Always visible in header bar (desktop: full search input, mobile: search icon â†’ expanding input)
  - Searches: Staff ID, staff name, MDA name, loan reference number
  - Instant results as-you-type (debounced 300ms)
  - Results grouped by type: Staff, MDAs, Loans
  - Keyboard shortcut: Ctrl+K / Cmd+K to focus search (power user pattern from Linear)

  Table Filtering:
  - Filter controls above table, collapsible on mobile
  - Filter by: MDA (dropdown), status (multi-select badges), date range (date picker)
  - Active filters shown as dismissible chips below filter bar
  - "Clear all filters" link when any filter is active
  - Filter state preserved in URL query parameters (shareable filtered views)

  Sort:
  - Click column header to toggle sort (ascending â†’ descending â†’ none)
  - Active sort indicated by teal arrow in column header
  - Default sort: most recent first (date), highest priority first (exceptions)

  ---
  Modal & Overlay Patterns

  Dialog (Confirmation):
  - Used for: destructive action confirmation, important decisions
  - Centred overlay with backdrop blur
  - Clear title, concise description, two buttons (cancel ghost + action primary/destructive)
  - Escape key and backdrop click dismiss (except destructive confirmation)

  Sheet (Mobile Sidebar & Detail Panels):
  - Used for: mobile navigation, quick detail views on mobile
  - Slides from left (navigation) or right (detail)
  - Full viewport height, 85% width max
  - Swipe to dismiss supported

  Tooltip:
  - Used for: icon-only buttons (rare), abbreviated text, supplementary information
  - Appears on hover (desktop) / long-press (mobile)
  - Max width 250px, plain text only
  - Never used for essential information â€” tooltips are supplementary

  Popover:
  - Used for: filter dropdowns, date pickers, contextual actions
  - Positioned below trigger element, responsive repositioning on viewport edge
  - Click outside or Escape to dismiss

  ---

  The MDA Officer Test: Before shipping any screen, ask: "Would an MDA officer feel defensive looking at this?" If yes, redesign the language, iconography, or colour 
  until the answer is no.

  ---
  Design System Integration Notes

  shadcn/ui Customisation:
  - Badge variants extended: review (gold), info (teal), complete (green), pending (grey), variance (grey bg + teal icon)
  - Toast (Sonner) themed: success (green left border), attention (gold left border), info (teal left border)
  - Table extended with dense mode toggle and sticky header
  - Command palette (search) themed with crimson accent on selected item
  - Sidebar component uses crimson background with white text override

  CSS Custom Properties (Pattern Tokens):
  --button-primary: #9C1E23
  --button-primary-hover: #7A181D
  --button-secondary: #0D7377
  --button-destructive: #DC2626
  --feedback-success: #16A34A
  --feedback-attention: #D4A017
  --feedback-variance-bg: #6B7280
  --feedback-variance-icon: #0D7377
  --feedback-pending: #6B7280
  --focus-ring: #0D7377

  Pattern Enforcement Strategy:
  - Non-punitive language patterns documented as linting rules in code review checklist
  - Colour usage restricted through Tailwind config â€” danger colours only available via destructive variant
  - Badge component enforces colour + text pairing â€” no text-less badges in the component API

  [A] Advanced Elicitation â€” refine consistency patterns deeper
  [P] Party Mode â€” bring multiple perspectives on UX consistency
  [C] Continue â€” save this to the document and move to responsive design & accessibility

  Here's the responsive and accessibility strategy for VLPRS, built around the dual-device paradigm established in earlier steps.                                       
  ---                                                                                                                                                                   Responsive Strategy

  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

  Desktop Strategy (>1024px):
  - Full 12-column grid layout (max-width 1280px, centred)
  - Fixed crimson sidebar (256px) with persistent navigation
  - Side-by-side comparison panels (ComparisonPanel in split mode)
  - Dense table mode available (36px rows for power users)
  - Multi-panel layouts: dashboard metrics + attention items side by side
  - Keyboard shortcuts enabled (Ctrl+K search, keyboard table navigation)

  Tablet Strategy (768-1024px):
  - 2-column metric cards (2x2 grid instead of 4-across)
  - Collapsible sidebar â€” defaults to collapsed icon-only (64px), expands on hover/click
  - Tables maintain horizontal scroll with sticky first column
  - Comparison panels stack vertically (declared above, computed below)
  - Touch targets maintained at 44x44px minimum

  Mobile Strategy (<768px):
  - Single column, full-width stacked layout
  - Crimson header bar replaces sidebar (hamburger menu â†’ Sheet overlay)
  - Hero metric cards full-width, stacked vertically (one per row)
  - Tables: horizontal scroll with sticky identifier column, or card-based view for simple lists
  - Comparison panels stacked vertically
  - Bottom action bar for primary actions (sticky, above keyboard on form screens)
  - Global search: icon in header â†’ expanding full-width search input on tap

  Breakpoint Strategy

  Network Performance Strategy

  Nigerian 4G Context (AG Dashboard Target: <3s):
  - Critical render path: HTML shell + CSS + hero metrics API call only. No JavaScript-blocking rendering of above-the-fold content.
  - Bundle splitting: Dashboard route loaded separately from data workflow routes. AG never downloads migration or exception queue code.
  - API response strategy: Hero metrics endpoint returns 4 numbers (<1KB). Attention items load asynchronously after metrics render.
  - Image optimisation: Oyo State crest as optimised SVG (<5KB). No raster images on dashboard.
  - Font loading: Inter variable font with font-display: swap â€” system font renders first, Inter replaces when loaded. Subset to Latin characters.
  - Service worker: Cache shell + static assets. Dashboard API response cached with 5-minute TTL for offline resilience.
  - Compression: Brotli compression on all text assets. Tailwind CSS purged to <30KB.

  Accessibility Strategy

  Compliance Level: WCAG 2.1 AA

  VLPRS targets WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance â€” the industry standard for government applications. Level AAA is not targeted but specific AAA criteria are met where   
  naturally achieved (e.g., contrast ratios exceed AAA for primary text).

  Rationale: As a Nigerian state government system, VLPRS should meet international accessibility standards to (a) serve all civil servants equitably, (b) demonstrate
   institutional quality, and (c) align with the Nigeria Data Protection Regulation's principle of fair processing.

  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

  Keyboard Navigation:
  - All interactive elements reachable via Tab key
  - Logical tab order matching visual layout (left-to-right, top-to-bottom)
  - Focus indicator: 2px solid #0D7377 (Deep Teal) ring on all focusable elements â€” clearly visible on both white and crimson backgrounds
  - Skip link: "Skip to main content" as first focusable element (hidden until focused)
  - Escape key closes all overlays (Dialog, Sheet, Popover, Command palette)
  - Enter/Space activates buttons and toggles
  - Arrow keys navigate within tables, tab lists, and command palette results
  - Ctrl+K / Cmd+K opens global search from any page

  Screen Reader Support:
  - Semantic HTML: <nav>, <main>, <header>, <footer>, <aside>, <section> landmarks
  - ARIA landmarks: role="navigation", role="main", role="search", role="complementary"
  - ARIA live regions: aria-live="polite" for toast notifications and submission confirmations
  - ARIA labels on all icon-only elements and custom components (specified per-component in Step 11)
  - Status badges always announce colour + text (e.g., screen reader reads "Status: Review" not just the colour)
  - Currency values: aria-label provides human-readable amount ("One million eight hundred forty thousand Naira")
  - Tables: <th scope="col"> for column headers, <th scope="row"> for row headers where applicable
  - Variance displays: Never use role="alert" â€” information, not emergency

  Focus Management:
  - On navigation (SPA route change): focus moves to page title <h1>
  - On dialog open: focus trapped within dialog, moves to first focusable element
  - On dialog close: focus returns to trigger element
  - On toast: does not steal focus â€” aria-live="polite" announces without interruption
  - On search result selection: focus moves to selected result's detail view

  Assistive Technology Considerations:
  - Radix UI primitives (via shadcn/ui) provide ARIA attributes at the foundation level
  - Custom components inherit and extend Radix accessibility (documented per-component in Step 11)
  - prefers-reduced-motion: reduce â€” disables count-up animations, skeleton pulse replaced with static placeholder
  - prefers-contrast: more â€” increase border contrast, remove subtle shadows, strengthen focus indicators
  - No title attributes on interactive elements (inconsistent AT support) â€” use aria-label instead

  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

  Accessibility Acceptance Criteria:
  - axe-core returns 0 violations on all pages
  - Lighthouse accessibility score â‰¥ 95
  - All critical flows completable via keyboard only
  - All content readable by screen reader with correct semantics
  - No information conveyed through colour alone

  Implementation Guidelines

  Responsive Development:
  - Use Tailwind responsive prefixes (md:, lg:, xl:) â€” mobile-first approach
  - Use rem for typography and spacing (scales with user font size preferences)
  - Use % and fr for layout widths (fluid grids)
  - Use px only for borders, shadows, and fixed chrome elements (sidebar width)
  - Test at 375px width as minimum viable viewport
  - Use <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"> â€” never disable zoom
  - Verify font-size: 16px minimum on inputs (prevents iOS auto-zoom)

  Accessibility Development:
  - Semantic HTML first â€” ARIA attributes only when native semantics insufficient
  - Every <img> has alt text (or alt="" + aria-hidden="true" for decorative images)
  - Every form input has a visible <label> linked via htmlFor
  - Focus management: use Radix UI's built-in focus trapping for overlays
  - Skip link as first element in <body>: <a href="#main-content" class="sr-only focus:not-sr-only">
  - Test with CSS disabled â€” content should still be readable in logical order
  - Use visually-hidden utility (Tailwind sr-only) for screen-reader-only text â€” never display: none for meaningful content

  Progressive Enhancement:
  - Dashboard renders meaningful content without JavaScript (SSR/SSG for initial paint where feasible)
  - Core information (loan balance, status) accessible without JavaScript
  - Enhanced interactions (animations, drill-down, filtering) require JavaScript
  - Service worker provides offline shell with "You're offline â€” data may be stale" message

  [A] Advanced Elicitation â€” refine responsive/accessibility strategy
  [P] Party Mode â€” bring inclusive design perspectives
  [C] Continue â€” save this to the document and complete the workflow

      1284 +## Responsive Design & Accessibility
      1285 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1286 +### Responsive Strategy                                                                                                                                   
      1287 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1288 +**Design Philosophy: Mobile-First Dashboard, Desktop-First Data**                                                                                         
      1289 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1290 +VLPRS has a unique responsive challenge â€” two fundamentally different primary use cases on two different devices:                                         
      1291 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1292 +| Context | Primary Device | Design Approach | Why |                                                                                                      
      1293 +|---------|---------------|----------------|-----|                                                                                                        
      1294 +| AG Dashboard | Phone (4G, Nigeria) | **Mobile-first** â€” design at 375px, scale up | The AG's morning glance is the system's political shield |          
      1295 +| MDA Submission | Office desktop | **Mobile-capable** â€” design at 1280px, degrade gracefully | 63 MDA officers use office machines, but occasional       
           + mobile use must work |                                                                                                                                   
      1296 +| Data Workflows (migration, exceptions, reports) | Desktop | **Desktop-first** â€” design at 1280px, mobile read-only | Dense data tables and compar       
           +ison panels require screen real estate |                                                                                                                  
      1297 +| Beneficiary Portal (Phase 2) | Phone | **Mobile-first** â€” design at 375px, scale up | Civil servants check loan balance like bank balance |             
      1298 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1299 +**Desktop Strategy (>1024px):**                                                                                                                           
      1300 +- Full 12-column grid layout (max-width 1280px, centred)                                                                                                  
      1301 +- Fixed crimson sidebar (256px) with persistent navigation                                                                                                
      1302 +- Side-by-side comparison panels (ComparisonPanel in split mode)                                                                                          
      1303 +- Dense table mode available (36px rows for power users)                                                                                                  
      1304 +- Multi-panel layouts: dashboard metrics + attention items side by side                                                                                   
      1305 +- Keyboard shortcuts enabled (Ctrl+K search, keyboard table navigation)                                                                                   
      1306 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1307 +**Tablet Strategy (768-1024px):**                                                                                                                         
      1308 +- 2-column metric cards (2x2 grid instead of 4-across)                                                                                                    
      1309 +- Collapsible sidebar â€” defaults to collapsed icon-only (64px), expands on hover/click                                                                    
      1310 +- Tables maintain horizontal scroll with sticky first column                                                                                              
      1311 +- Comparison panels stack vertically (declared above, computed below)                                                                                     
      1312 +- Touch targets maintained at 44x44px minimum                                                                                                             
      1313 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1314 +**Mobile Strategy (<768px):**                                                                                                                             
      1315 +- Single column, full-width stacked layout                                                                                                                
      1316 +- Crimson header bar replaces sidebar (hamburger menu â†’ Sheet overlay)                                                                                    
      1317 +- Hero metric cards full-width, stacked vertically (one per row)                                                                                          
      1318 +- Tables: horizontal scroll with sticky identifier column, or card-based view for simple lists                                                            
      1319 +- Comparison panels stacked vertically

      1322 +

      1352 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1353 +### Network Performance Strategy                                                                                                                          
      1354 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1355 +**Nigerian 4G Context (AG Dashboard Target: <3s):**                                                                                                       
      1356 +- **Critical render path:** HTML shell + CSS + hero metrics API call only. No JavaScript-blocking rendering of above-the-fold content.                    
      1357 +- **Bundle splitting:** Dashboard route loaded separately from data workflow routes. AG never downloads migration or exception queue code.                
      1358 +- **API response strategy:** Hero metrics endpoint returns 4 numbers (<1KB). Attention items load asynchronously after metrics render.                    
      1359 +- **Image optimisation:** Oyo State crest as optimised SVG (<5KB). No raster images on dashboard.                                                         
      1360 +- **Font loading:** Inter variable font with `font-display: swap` â€” system font renders first, Inter replaces when loaded. Subset to Latin characte       
           +rs.                                                                                                                                                       
      1361 +- **Service worker:** Cache shell + static assets. Dashboard API response cached with 5-minute TTL for offline resilience.                                
      1362 +- **Compression:** Brotli compression on all text assets. Tailwind CSS purged to <30KB.                                                                   
      1363 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1364 +**Performance Budgets:**                                                                                                                                  
      1365 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1366 +| Metric | Target | Rationale |                                                                                                                           
      1367 +|--------|--------|-----------|                                                                                                                           
      1368 +| First Contentful Paint (FCP) | <1.5s on 4G | Skeleton loaders must appear fast |                                                                        
      1369 +| Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) | <3.0s on 4G | AG dashboard hero metrics fully rendered |                                                               
      1370 +| Time to Interactive (TTI) | <3.5s on 4G | Dashboard clickable (drill-down) |                                                                            
      1371 +| Total bundle (dashboard route) | <150KB gzipped | Minimise download on 4G |                                                                             
      1372 +| API payload (dashboard) | <5KB | 4 numbers + attention items |                                                                                          
      1373 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1374 +### Accessibility Strategy                                                                                                                                
      1375 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1376 +**Compliance Level: WCAG 2.1 AA**                                                                                                                         
      1377 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1378 +VLPRS targets WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance â€” the industry standard for government applications. Level AAA is not targeted but specific AAA criteria       
           + are met where naturally achieved (e.g., contrast ratios exceed AAA for primary text).                                                                    
      1379 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1380 +**Colour Contrast Compliance:**                                                                                                                           
      1381 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1382 +| Element | Foreground | Background | Ratio | Requirement | Status |                                                                                      
      1383 +|---------|-----------|-----------|-------|-------------|--------|                                                                                        
      1384 +| Primary text | `#1E293B` | `#FFFFFF` | 12.6:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Exceeds |                                                                                  
      1385 +| Secondary text | `#64748B` | `#FFFFFF` | 4.6:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Meets |                                                                                   
      1386 +| Sidebar text | `#FFFFFF` | `#9C1E23` | 7.2:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Exceeds |                                                                                   
      1387 +| Teal links | `#0D7377` | `#FFFFFF` | 5.1:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Meets |                                                                                       
      1388 +| Gold badge text | `#92400E` | `#FDF8E8` | 5.8:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Meets |                                                                                  
      1389 +| Hero metric (large) | `#1E293B` | `#FFFFFF` | 12.6:1 | 3:1 (AA large) | Exceeds |                                                                       
      1390 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1391 +**Keyboard Navigation:**                                                                                                                                  
      1392 +- All interactive elements reachable via Tab key                                                                                                          
      1393 +- Logical tab order matching visual layout (left-to-right, top-to-bottom)                                                                                 
      1394 +- Focus indicator: 2px solid `#0D7377` (Deep Teal) ring on all focusable elements                                                                         
      1395 +- Skip link: "Skip to main content" as first focusable element (hidden until focused)                                                                     
      1396 +- Escape key closes all overlays (Dialog, Sheet, Popover, Command palette)                                                                                
      1397 +- Enter/Space activates buttons and toggles                                                                                                               
      1398 +- Arrow keys navigate within tables, tab lists, and command palette results                                                                               
      1399 +- Ctrl+K / Cmd+K opens global search from any page                                                                                                        
      1400 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1401 +**Screen Reader Support:**                                                                                                                                
      1402 +- Semantic HTML: `<nav>`, `<main>`, `<header>`, `<footer>`, `<aside>`, `<section>` landmarks                                                              
      1403 +- ARIA landmarks: `role="navigation"`, `role="main"`, `role="search"`, `role="complementary"`                                                             
      1404 +- ARIA live regions: `aria-live="polite"` for toast notifications and submission confirmations                                                            
      1405 +- ARIA labels on all icon-only elements and custom components (per Step 11 specifications)                                                                
      1406 +- Status badges announce colour + text (screen reader reads "Status: Review" not just the colour)                                                         
      1407 +- Currency values: `aria-label` provides human-readable amount                                                                                            
      1408 +- Tables: `<th scope="col">` for column headers, `<th scope="row">` for row headers                                                                       
      1409 +- Variance displays: Never use `role="alert"` â€” information, not emergency                                                                                
      1410 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1411 +**Focus Management:**                                                                                                                                     
      1412 +- On navigation (SPA route change): focus moves to page title `<h1>`                                                                                      
      1413 +- On dialog open: focus trapped within dialog, moves to first focusable element                                                                           
      1414 +- On dialog close: focus returns to trigger element                                                                                                       
      1415 +- On toast: does not steal focus â€” `aria-live="polite"` announces without interruption                                                                    
      1416 +- On search result selection: focus moves to selected result's detail view                                                                                
      1417 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1418 +**Assistive Technology Considerations:**                                                                                                                  
      1419 +- Radix UI primitives provide ARIA attributes at the foundation level                                                                                     
      1420 +- `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce` â€” disables count-up animations, skeleton pulse replaced with static placeholder                                        
      1421 +- `prefers-contrast: more` â€” increase border contrast, remove subtle shadows, strengthen focus indicators                                                 
      1422 +- No `title` attributes on interactive elements â€” use `aria-label` instead                                                                                
      1423 +

      1227 +- Used for: icon-only buttons (rare), abbreviated text, supplementary information                                                                         
      1228 +- Appears on hover (desktop) / long-press (mobile)                                                                                                        
      1229 +- Max width 250px, plain text only                                                                                                                        
      1230 +- Never used for essential information â€” tooltips are supplementary                                                                                       
      1231 +

      1233 +- Used for: filter dropdowns, date pickers, contextual actions                                                                                            
      1234 +- Positioned below trigger element, responsive repositioning on viewport edge                                                                             
      1235 +- Click outside or Escape to dismiss                                                                                                                      
      1236 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1237 +### Non-Punitive Language Patterns                                                                                                                        
      1238 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1239 +The most critical consistency pattern in the entire system. These rules have absolute authority over all other UX patterns:                               
      1240 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1241 +| Context | Use This | Never This |                                                                                                                       
      1242 +|---------|----------|------------|                                                                                                                       
      1243 +| Upload validation failure | "Upload needs attention" | "Upload failed" / "Error" |                                                                      
      1244 +| Data discrepancy found | "Comparison Complete" | "Errors Found" / "Validation Failed" |                                                                 
      1245 +| Record doesn't match | "Variance: â‚¦4,166.25" | "Error: â‚¦4,166.25 discrepancy" |                                                                         
      1246 +| MDA hasn't submitted | "Pending â€” Awaiting March 2026" | "Overdue â€” March 2026 missing" |                                                               
      1247 +| Legacy data mismatch | "Administrative variance" | "Calculation error" |                                                                                
      1248 +| Migration categorisation | "Clean / Minor / Significant / Structural" | "Correct / Warning / Error / Critical" |                                        
      1249 +| Variance icon | Info circle (â„¹) in teal | Warning triangle (âš ) in amber/red |                                                                           
      1250 +| Variance background | Neutral grey `#6B7280` | Red or amber background |                                                                                
      1251 +| MDA performance | Never compare MDAs against each other | No league tables, rankings, or scores |                                                       
      1252 +| Exception flagged | "This needs review" | "This is wrong" |                                                                                             
      1253 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1254 +**The MDA Officer Test:** Before shipping any screen, ask: "Would an MDA officer feel defensive looking at this?" If yes, redesign the language, ic       
           +onography, or colour until the answer is no.

  - Side-by-side comparison panels (ComparisonPanel in split mode)
  - Dense table mode available (36px rows for power users)
  - Multi-panel layouts: dashboard metrics + attention items side by side
  - Keyboard shortcuts enabled (Ctrl+K search, keyboard table navigation)

  Tablet Strategy (768-1024px):
  - 2-column metric cards (2x2 grid instead of 4-across)
  - Collapsible sidebar â€” defaults to collapsed icon-only (64px), expands on hover/click
  - Tables maintain horizontal scroll with sticky first column
  - Comparison panels stack vertically (declared above, computed below)
  - Touch targets maintained at 44x44px minimum

  Mobile Strategy (<768px):
  - Single column, full-width stacked layout
  - Crimson header bar replaces sidebar (hamburger menu â†’ Sheet overlay)
  - Hero metric cards full-width, stacked vertically (one per row)
  - Tables: horizontal scroll with sticky identifier column, or card-based view for simple lists
  - Comparison panels stacked vertically
  - Bottom action bar for primary actions (sticky, above keyboard on form screens)
  - Global search: icon in header â†’ expanding full-width search input on tap

  Network Performance Strategy

  Nigerian 4G Context (AG Dashboard Target: <3s):
  - Critical render path: HTML shell + CSS + hero metrics API call only. No JavaScript-blocking rendering of above-the-fold content.
  - Bundle splitting: Dashboard route loaded separately from data workflow routes. AG never downloads migration or exception queue code.
  - API response strategy: Hero metrics endpoint returns 4 numbers (<1KB). Attention items load asynchronously after metrics render.
  - Image optimisation: Oyo State crest as optimised SVG (<5KB). No raster images on dashboard.
  - Font loading: Inter variable font with font-display: swap â€” system font renders first, Inter replaces when loaded. Subset to Latin characters.
  - Service worker: Cache shell + static assets. Dashboard API response cached with 5-minute TTL for offline resilience.
  - Compression: Brotli compression on all text assets. Tailwind CSS purged to <30KB.

  Accessibility Strategy

  Compliance Level: WCAG 2.1 AA

  VLPRS targets WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance â€” the industry standard for government applications. Level AAA is not targeted but specific AAA criteria are met where   
  naturally achieved (e.g., contrast ratios exceed AAA for primary text).

  Rationale: As a Nigerian state government system, VLPRS should meet international accessibility standards to (a) serve all civil servants equitably, (b) demonstrate
   institutional quality, and (c) align with the Nigeria Data Protection Regulation's principle of fair processing.
