  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

  Keyboard Navigation:
  - All interactive elements reachable via Tab key
  - Logical tab order matching visual layout (left-to-right, top-to-bottom)
  - Focus indicator: 2px solid #0D7377 (Deep Teal) ring on all focusable elements â€” clearly visible on both white and crimson backgrounds
  - Skip link: "Skip to main content" as first focusable element (hidden until focused)
  - Escape key closes all overlays (Dialog, Sheet, Popover, Command palette)
  - Enter/Space activates buttons and toggles
  - Arrow keys navigate within tables, tab lists, and command palette results
  - Ctrl+K / Cmd+K opens global search from any page

  Screen Reader Support:
  - Semantic HTML: <nav>, <main>, <header>, <footer>, <aside>, <section> landmarks
  - ARIA landmarks: role="navigation", role="main", role="search", role="complementary"
  - ARIA live regions: aria-live="polite" for toast notifications and submission confirmations
  - ARIA labels on all icon-only elements and custom components (specified per-component in Step 11)
  - Status badges always announce colour + text (e.g., screen reader reads "Status: Review" not just the colour)
  - Currency values: aria-label provides human-readable amount ("One million eight hundred forty thousand Naira")
  - Tables: <th scope="col"> for column headers, <th scope="row"> for row headers where applicable
  - Variance displays: Never use role="alert" â€” information, not emergency

  Focus Management:
  - On navigation (SPA route change): focus moves to page title <h1>
  - On dialog open: focus trapped within dialog, moves to first focusable element
  - On dialog close: focus returns to trigger element
  - On toast: does not steal focus â€” aria-live="polite" announces without interruption
  - On search result selection: focus moves to selected result's detail view

  Assistive Technology Considerations:
  - Radix UI primitives (via shadcn/ui) provide ARIA attributes at the foundation level
  - Custom components inherit and extend Radix accessibility (documented per-component in Step 11)
  - prefers-reduced-motion: reduce â€” disables count-up animations, skeleton pulse replaced with static placeholder
  - prefers-contrast: more â€” increase border contrast, remove subtle shadows, strengthen focus indicators
  - No title attributes on interactive elements (inconsistent AT support) â€” use aria-label instead

  Accessibility Acceptance Criteria:
  - axe-core returns 0 violations on all pages
  - Lighthouse accessibility score â‰¥ 95
  - All critical flows completable via keyboard only
  - All content readable by screen reader with correct semantics
  - No information conveyed through colour alone

  Implementation Guidelines

  Responsive Development:
  - Use Tailwind responsive prefixes (md:, lg:, xl:) â€” mobile-first approach
  - Use rem for typography and spacing (scales with user font size preferences)
  - Use % and fr for layout widths (fluid grids)
  - Use px only for borders, shadows, and fixed chrome elements (sidebar width)
  - Test at 375px width as minimum viable viewport
  - Use <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"> â€” never disable zoom
  - Verify font-size: 16px minimum on inputs (prevents iOS auto-zoom)

  Accessibility Development:
  - Semantic HTML first â€” ARIA attributes only when native semantics insufficient
  - Every <img> has alt text (or alt="" + aria-hidden="true" for decorative images)
  - Every form input has a visible <label> linked via htmlFor
  - Focus management: use Radix UI's built-in focus trapping for overlays
  - Skip link as first element in <body>: <a href="#main-content" class="sr-only focus:not-sr-only">
  - Test with CSS disabled â€” content should still be readable in logical order
  - Use visually-hidden utility (Tailwind sr-only) for screen-reader-only text â€” never display: none for meaningful content

  Progressive Enhancement:
  - Dashboard renders meaningful content without JavaScript (SSR/SSG for initial paint where feasible)
  - Core information (loan balance, status) accessible without JavaScript
  - Enhanced interactions (animations, drill-down, filtering) require JavaScript
  - Service worker provides offline shell with "You're offline â€” data may be stale" message

  [P] Party Mode â€” bring inclusive design perspectives
  [C] Continue â€” save this to the document and complete the workflow

      1311 +- Comparison panels stack vertically (declared above, computed below)                                                                                     
      1312 +- Touch targets maintained at 44x44px minimum                                                                                                             
      1313 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1314 +**Mobile Strategy (<768px):**                                                                                                                             
      1315 +- Single column, full-width stacked layout                                                                                                                
      1316 +- Crimson header bar replaces sidebar (hamburger menu â†’ Sheet overlay)                                                                                    
      1317 +- Hero metric cards full-width, stacked vertically (one per row)                                                                                          
      1318 +- Tables: horizontal scroll with sticky identifier column, or card-based view for simple lists                                                            
      1319 +- Comparison panels stacked vertically                                                                                                                    
      1320 +- Bottom action bar for primary actions (sticky, above keyboard on form screens)

      1322 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1323 +### Breakpoint Strategy                                                                                                                                   
      1324 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1325 +**Breakpoints (Tailwind CSS defaults, extended):**                                                                                                        
      1326 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1327 +| Breakpoint | Width | Tailwind Prefix | Layout Change |                                                                                                  
      1328 +|-----------|-------|----------------|--------------|                                                                                                     
      1329 +| Mobile (base) | 0-767px | (default) | Single column, stacked cards, hamburger menu, sheet navigation |                                                  
      1330 +| Tablet | 768px+ | `md:` | 2-column metrics, collapsible sidebar, horizontal table scroll |                                                              
      1331 +| Desktop | 1024px+ | `lg:` | Full grid, fixed sidebar, side-by-side panels, dense table toggle |                                                         
      1332 +| Wide Desktop | 1280px+ | `xl:` | Max-width container, increased whitespace, 4-across metric cards |                                                     
      1333 +

      1336 +- `md:` prefix adds tablet enhancements                                                                                                                   
      1337 +- `lg:` prefix adds desktop layout                                                                                                                        
      1338 +- Tailwind's mobile-first approach: `class="flex flex-col md:flex-row lg:grid lg:grid-cols-4"`                                                            
      1339 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1340 +**Component-Level Responsive Behaviour:**                                                                                                                 
      1341 +

      1343 +|-----------|--------|--------|---------|

      1352 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1353 +### Network Performance Strategy                                                                                                                          
      1354 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1355 +**Nigerian 4G Context (AG Dashboard Target: <3s):**                                                                                                       
      1356 +- **Critical render path:** HTML shell + CSS + hero metrics API call only. No JavaScript-blocking rendering of above-the-fold content.                    
      1357 +- **Bundle splitting:** Dashboard route loaded separately from data workflow routes. AG never downloads migration or exception queue code.                
      1358 +- **API response strategy:** Hero metrics endpoint returns 4 numbers (<1KB). Attention items load asynchronously after metrics render.                    
      1359 +- **Image optimisation:** Oyo State crest as optimised SVG (<5KB). No raster images on dashboard.                                                         
      1360 +- **Font loading:** Inter variable font with `font-display: swap` â€” system font renders first, Inter replaces when loaded. Subset to Latin characte       
           +rs.                                                                                                                                                       
      1361 +- **Service worker:** Cache shell + static assets. Dashboard API response cached with 5-minute TTL for offline resilience.                                
      1362 +- **Compression:** Brotli compression on all text assets. Tailwind CSS purged to <30KB.                                                                   
      1363 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1364 +**Performance Budgets:**                                                                                                                                  
      1365 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1366 +| Metric | Target | Rationale |                                                                                                                           
      1367 +|--------|--------|-----------|                                                                                                                           
      1368 +| First Contentful Paint (FCP) | <1.5s on 4G | Skeleton loaders must appear fast |                                                                        
      1369 +| Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) | <3.0s on 4G | AG dashboard hero metrics fully rendered |                                                               
      1370 +| Time to Interactive (TTI) | <3.5s on 4G | Dashboard clickable (drill-down) |                                                                            
      1371 +| Total bundle (dashboard route) | <150KB gzipped | Minimise download on 4G |                                                                             
      1372 +| API payload (dashboard) | <5KB | 4 numbers + attention items |                                                                                          
      1373 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1374 +### Accessibility Strategy                                                                                                                                
      1375 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1376 +**Compliance Level: WCAG 2.1 AA**                                                                                                                         
      1377 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1378 +VLPRS targets WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance â€” the industry standard for government applications. Level AAA is not targeted but specific AAA criteria       
           + are met where naturally achieved (e.g., contrast ratios exceed AAA for primary text).                                                                    
      1379 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1380 +**Colour Contrast Compliance:**                                                                                                                           
      1381 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1382 +| Element | Foreground | Background | Ratio | Requirement | Status |                                                                                      
      1383 +|---------|-----------|-----------|-------|-------------|--------|                                                                                        
      1384 +| Primary text | `#1E293B` | `#FFFFFF` | 12.6:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Exceeds |                                                                                  
      1385 +| Secondary text | `#64748B` | `#FFFFFF` | 4.6:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Meets |                                                                                   
      1386 +| Sidebar text | `#FFFFFF` | `#9C1E23` | 7.2:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Exceeds |                                                                                   
      1387 +| Teal links | `#0D7377` | `#FFFFFF` | 5.1:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Meets |                                                                                       
      1388 +| Gold badge text | `#92400E` | `#FDF8E8` | 5.8:1 | 4.5:1 (AA) | Meets |                                                                                  
      1389 +| Hero metric (large) | `#1E293B` | `#FFFFFF` | 12.6:1 | 3:1 (AA large) | Exceeds |                                                                       
      1390 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1391 +**Keyboard Navigation:**                                                                                                                                  
      1392 +- All interactive elements reachable via Tab key                                                                                                          
      1393 +- Logical tab order matching visual layout (left-to-right, top-to-bottom)                                                                                 
      1394 +- Focus indicator: 2px solid `#0D7377` (Deep Teal) ring on all focusable elements                                                                         
      1395 +- Skip link: "Skip to main content" as first focusable element (hidden until focused)                                                                     
      1396 +- Escape key closes all overlays (Dialog, Sheet, Popover, Command palette)                                                                                
      1397 +- Enter/Space activates buttons and toggles                                                                                                               
      1398 +- Arrow keys navigate within tables, tab lists, and command palette results                                                                               
      1399 +- Ctrl+K / Cmd+K opens global search from any page                                                                                                        
      1400 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1401 +**Screen Reader Support:**                                                                                                                                
      1402 +- Semantic HTML: `<nav>`, `<main>`, `<header>`, `<footer>`, `<aside>`, `<section>` landmarks                                                              
      1403 +- ARIA landmarks: `role="navigation"`, `role="main"`, `role="search"`, `role="complementary"`                                                             
      1404 +- ARIA live regions: `aria-live="polite"` for toast notifications and submission confirmations                                                            
      1405 +- ARIA labels on all icon-only elements and custom components (per Step 11 specifications)                                                                
      1406 +- Status badges announce colour + text (screen reader reads "Status: Review" not just the colour)                                                         
      1407 +- Currency values: `aria-label` provides human-readable amount                                                                                            
      1408 +- Tables: `<th scope="col">` for column headers, `<th scope="row">` for row headers                                                                       
      1409 +- Variance displays: Never use `role="alert"` â€” information, not emergency                                                                                
      1410 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1411 +**Focus Management:**                                                                                                                                     
      1412 +- On navigation (SPA route change): focus moves to page title `<h1>`                                                                                      
      1413 +- On dialog open: focus trapped within dialog, moves to first focusable element                                                                           
      1414 +- On dialog close: focus returns to trigger element                                                                                                       
      1415 +- On toast: does not steal focus â€” `aria-live="polite"` announces without interruption                                                                    
      1416 +- On search result selection: focus moves to selected result's detail view                                                                                
      1417 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1418 +**Assistive Technology Considerations:**                                                                                                                  
      1419 +- Radix UI primitives provide ARIA attributes at the foundation level                                                                                     
      1420 +- `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce` â€” disables count-up animations, skeleton pulse replaced with static placeholder                                        
      1421 +- `prefers-contrast: more` â€” increase border contrast, remove subtle shadows, strengthen focus indicators                                                 
      1422 +- No `title` attributes on interactive elements â€” use `aria-label` instead                                                                                
      1423 +

      1466 +                                                                                                                                                          
      1467 +**Responsive Development:**

  Key architectural aspects I notice:

  1. Immutable financial ledger is THE architectural constraint. No UPDATE or DELETE on financial records â€” enforced at database AND API level. Balances are computed 
  views, never stored state. This is a banking-grade pattern that eliminates an entire class of data integrity bugs but requires careful schema design.
  2. Computation engine must be deterministic and 100% accurate. 4 loan tiers, moratorium, auto-split, last-payment adjustment, early exit, retirement settlement â€”   
  all parameterised, not per-tier code paths. Kobo-level precision means decimal types everywhere, never floating point. This engine IS the system's credibility.     
  3. Dual-device paradigm drives SPA architecture. AG dashboard on phone (4G, <3s LCP) coexisting with desktop data workflows (migration tool, exception queues,      
  16-column tables). Mobile-first for dashboard, desktop-first for operations. PWA basic installability.
  4. RBAC at API level is non-negotiable. 3 MVP roles (Super Admin, Department Admin, MDA Reporting Officer). MDA officers see ONLY their MDA's data â€” tenant-like    
  isolation. Every API endpoint must enforce role checks server-side. No client-side-only access control.
  5. Audit trail is pervasive. Every action logged with timestamp, user ID, role, IP. Audit logs are append-only (no modification). Read-only audit role in Phase 2.  
  This is a cross-cutting concern that touches every module.
  6. MVP is intentionally standalone. No external integrations in MVP â€” CSV upload and manual entry only. API-first architecture enables future payroll
  cross-verification and gratuity system integration without restructuring.
  7. Migration is a one-time but architecturally significant operation. 63 MDAs, 3,100+ loans, snapshot-forward approach. Column mapping, variance categorisation (5  
  categories), baseline ledger entry creation. Migration tool is temporary but critical to system trust.
  8. Non-punitive design is an architectural constraint, not just UX. Error messages, API responses, status codes, and database enum values must all use the approved 
  vocabulary ("variance" not "error", "comparison" not "validation failure"). This affects API contract design.

  UX-Driven Architectural Requirements:

  From the completed UX spec (14 steps, ~1,400 lines):
  - SPA with two zones: Public (unauthenticated) + Protected (role-based dashboard)
  - Design system: shadcn/ui + Tailwind CSS + Radix UI â€” component library already specified
  - 11 custom components designed with full specs (HeroMetricCard, NonPunitiveVarianceDisplay, ComparisonPanel, FileUploadZone, AutoStopCertificate, etc.)
  - Performance budgets: FCP <1.5s, LCP <3s, TTI <3.5s, dashboard route <150KB gzipped
  - Responsive breakpoints: Mobile (<768px), Tablet (768-1024px), Desktop (>1024px)
  - Font loading: Inter variable + JetBrains Mono (monospace for financial figures)
  - PDF generation: Branded reports with Oyo State crest, client or server-side

  Scale Indicators:

  - Complexity level: High â€” financial computation engine, immutable ledger, RBAC, migration tool, 5 user roles, audit trail, PDF generation
  - Primary domain: Full-stack web (govtech-fintech)
  - Data complexity: Medium-high â€” relational with immutable append-only financial records, computed views, multi-tenant-like MDA isolation
  - User interaction complexity: Medium â€” dashboard drill-down, CSV upload, comparison views, exception queues
  - Integration complexity: Low (MVP standalone) â†’ Medium (Phase 2 external integrations)
  - Regulatory compliance: High â€” NDPR, government financial audit requirements, segregation of duties

  Technical Constraints:

  1. Solo developer â€” architecture must maximise velocity without sacrificing correctness
  2. Nigerian 4G network â€” dashboard must be performant on constrained bandwidth
  3. Data sovereignty â€” system and data accessible within Nigeria
  4. No floating point for money â€” decimal/numeric types mandatory
  5. Immutable ledger â€” INSERT only, no UPDATE/DELETE on financial records
  6. Computed views â€” balances derived from ledger, never stored as mutable state
  7. API-first â€” all data access through structured endpoints for future integration readiness

  Cross-Cutting Concerns:

  1. Audit logging â€” every action, every module, append-only
  2. RBAC enforcement â€” API-level, every endpoint
  3. Financial computation accuracy â€” 100% deterministic, kobo-precise
  4. Immutability guarantees â€” database + API level enforcement
  5. Non-punitive vocabulary â€” API responses, error messages, database enums
  6. Input validation â€” server-side at all system boundaries
  7. Transaction atomicity â€” all-or-nothing for submissions, migrations, state transitions

  ---

  [A] Advanced Elicitation â€” dive deeper into architectural implications
  [P] Party Mode â€” bring different perspectives to analyse requirements
  [C] Continue â€” save this analysis and begin architectural decisions

â— Now on Step 2: Design Epic List. Let me review the extracted requirements and design the epic structure.                                                
  With 59 FRs, 31 NFRs, and extensive additional requirements from Architecture and UX, here's my proposed epic structure organised around user value,  
  not technical layers:
                                                                                                                                                          ---                                                                                                                                                   
  Proposed Epic Structure (9 Epics)

  Epic 1: Project Foundation & Secure Access

  User Outcome: Users can securely log into VLPRS with role-appropriate access. All actions are audit-logged. The development/deployment infrastructure 
  is fully operational.

  FRs covered: FR42, FR43, FR44, FR45, FR46, FR47, FR48

  Notes: Includes monorepo scaffold (architecture starter template), Docker setup, database foundation, JWT auth with refresh token rotation, RBAC      
  middleware, audit logging, CI/CD pipeline. This is the prerequisite for everything â€” the first implementation story is project initialisation per the 
  Architecture document.

  ---
  Epic 2: Loan Data Management & Financial Computation

  User Outcome: System maintains an immutable financial record and computes accurate loan schedules, balances, and repayment breakdowns for all 4       
  grade-level tiers. Any balance is reconstructable from the ledger. Loan lifecycle is fully tracked.

  FRs covered: FR1, FR2, FR3, FR4, FR5, FR6, FR10, FR11, FR12, FR13, FR14, FR15

  Notes: The mathematical core â€” decimal.js arithmetic, 3-layer immutable ledger enforcement, UUIDv7 keys, computed views. Must be 100% accurate before 
  any data enters the system.

  ---
  Epic 3: Data Migration & Legacy Import

  User Outcome: Department Admin can import legacy MDA spreadsheet data, validate and categorise records, acknowledge variances with non-punitive       
  language, and establish baselines for all 63 MDAs.

  FRs covered: FR25, FR26, FR27, FR28, FR29, FR30, FR31

  Notes: Column mapping, variance categorisation (Clean/Minor/Significant/Structural/Anomalous), side-by-side comparison with mathematical explanation, 
  Migration Dashboard tracking all 63 MDAs. Gets real data into the system â€” the AG sees actual numbers for the first time.

  ---
  Epic 4: Executive Dashboard & Scheme Visibility

  User Outcome: AG opens VLPRS on her phone and instantly sees scheme-wide status â€” 4 headline numbers, attention items, compliance status â€” with       
  drill-down to any MDA or individual loan. The 30-second truth.

  FRs covered: FR32, FR33, FR34, FR35, FR36

  Notes: Mobile-first hero metrics (<3s on 4G), progressive drill-down (Dashboard â†’ MDA â†’ Loan), attention items with priority indicators, MDA
  compliance view. The flagship experience and the system's political shield.

  ---
  Epic 5: MDA Monthly Submission

  User Outcome: MDA Reporting Officers can submit monthly deduction data via 6-field CSV upload or manual entry, receive instant confirmation with      
  reference number, and see neutral comparison summaries with variance detail.

  FRs covered: FR16, FR17, FR18, FR19, FR20, FR21, FR22, FR23, FR24

  Notes: Atomic upload (all-or-nothing), duplicate detection, period lock, neutral language enforcement ("Comparison Complete" not "Errors Found"),     
  FileUploadZone + SubmissionConfirmation custom components. The adoption engine â€” if this is easier than 17-column spreadsheets, resistance collapses. 

  ---
  Epic 6: Reporting & PDF Export

  User Outcome: Admins can generate Executive Summary, MDA Compliance, Variance, and Loan Snapshot reports. All reports exportable as branded PDFs with 
  Oyo State Government crest and shareable via one-tap action.

  FRs covered: FR37, FR38, FR39, FR40, FR41, FR53, FR54

  Notes: Server-side PDF generation via @react-pdf/renderer, branded output suitable for AG/Commissioner circulation, weekly AG report covering 7-day   
  period. System provably correct through reports.

  ---
  Epic 7: Exception Management & Record Annotations

  User Outcome: Admin can flag loan records as exceptions, investigate via a priority-sorted queue with filters, resolve with notes and audit trail.    
  Department Admin can annotate records for institutional memory and correct event flags through a tracked workflow.

  FRs covered: FR55, FR56, FR57, FR58, FR59

  Notes: ExceptionQueueRow custom component (Linear-inspired), auto-flagging inactive loans (60+ days no deduction), correction workflow logging        
  original/new values. Preserves Mr. Okonkwo's institutional knowledge.

  ---
  Epic 8: Auto-Stop Certificate & Loan Completion

  User Outcome: When a loan balance reaches zero, the system automatically generates an official Auto-Stop Certificate with verification code and QR,   
  and sends it to both the beneficiary and MDA Reporting Officer with instruction to cease deductions.

  FRs covered: FR7, FR8, FR9

  Notes: The system's emotional climax â€” premium visual treatment (gold border, Oyo State crest, green celebration). AutoStopCertificate custom
  component. Dual notification. The "never over-deducted again" guarantee made tangible.

  ---
  Epic 9: Notifications & Automated Alerts

  User Outcome: System automatically sends email submission reminders (T-3), overdue alerts (T+1), and loan completion notifications â€” keeping all      
  stakeholders informed without manual intervention. The operational loop is complete.

  FRs covered: FR49, FR50, FR51, FR52

  Notes: Resend transactional emails, node-cron for scheduled reminders, consolidated non-compliance list to Department Admin. No manual follow-up      
  required.

  ---
